greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Square array A(row,col): A(1,col) = A276937(col), and for row > 1, A(row,col) = A003961(A(row-1,col)), read by descending antidiagonals: A(1,1), A(1,2), A(2,1), A(1,3), A(2,2), A(3,1), etc.
comment: The starting offset is 2 because 1 is not included in the array proper. With it the terms are a permutation of A276078.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 2..1276; the first 50 antidiagonals of array
formula: A(1,col) = A276937(col), and for row > 1, A(row,col) = A003961(A(row-1,col)).
example: The top left corner of the array:
program: (define (A276941bi row col) (if (= 1 row) (A276937 col) (A003961 (A276941bi (- row 1) col))))
xref: Topmost row: A276937, second row: A276938. Leftmost column: A000040.
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Sep 25 2016
